definition: to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: The general swore to take back this island whatever the cost.
sentences.chinese: 我位将军发誓不惜任何代价夺回这个岛。

sentences.english: Tong's Spear should be the number one on the weapon list.
sentences.chinese: 我们唐家霸王枪要夺回兵器谱上的排名。

sentences.english: Back after black box, ray big mother.
sentences.chinese: 夺回黑盒子之后，雷母大喜。

sentences.english: Can he recapture that lyricism and hunger he had before?
sentences.chinese: 他能否夺回他的抒情性和饥饿面前？

sentences.english: At the second lap, Sean He regained the leading position.
sentences.chinese: 但在第二圈，何贤磊又夺回了首位。

sentences.english: The army has recaptured territory, including Swat's main town, Mingora.
sentences.chinese: 军队夺回了该领土，包括斯瓦特的主要城镇明戈拉。

sentences.english: Regaining the mantle of England's most decorated champions from Manchester United is imperative.
sentences.chinese: 从曼联手中夺回英国最显赫的锦标，势在必行。

sentences.english: I'm going to take our country back.
sentences.chinese: 我会回去把我们的国家夺回来。

sentences.english: Europe is looking to recapture the Ryder Cup after falling to the US in 2008.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲队期望在2008年输给美国后重新夺回莱德杯。

sentences.english: They retook a fortress in the naval port.
sentences.chinese: 他们夺回军港中的一个要塞。

sentences.english: Joint Maritime, Land and Air campaign to retake the Falkland Islands.
sentences.chinese: 联合海上，陆地和空中的运动，以夺回福克兰群岛。

sentences.english: Now ordinary Icelanders are determined to take their country back.
sentences.chinese: 现在，冰岛人民决定要把这个国家夺回来。

sentences.english: Before he could attempt to recover it, it was broken, and behind the fire.
sentences.chinese: 在他想夺回来以前，烟斗已经折断，扔在火里了。

sentences.english: Our forward position was recaptured with the aid of the friendly forces.
sentences.chinese: 在友军的帮助下，我们又夺回了前沿阵地。

sentences.english: Markal will have the way to capture Hikm and return the Amulet .
sentences.chinese: 马卡尔必须设法占领希金，夺回护身符。

definition: to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
